com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling

Class HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStore

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.JournalingPersistentStoreBase
      • com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStore
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    IByteArrayStore, IVersionedSizedStore, IPersistentByteArrayStore, IJournalingStoreAccessor, Closeable, AutoCloseable

    public final class HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStore
extends JournalingPersistentStoreBase
    High-capacity indexed journal implementation providing an historical list behaviour: it is only possible to append to the end of the list, remove from the end of the list, or clear the list.

    Due to the above limitations, this implementation is mainly suitable when an historical behaviour is desired, i.e. when the list only grows or gets cleared. By contrast with the regular indexed journaling store implementation provided by IndexedJournalingPersistentStore which fully supports list-related operations, this implementation has a much lower memory footprint (see below for details) and does not require that the whole journal be scanned at load time. It can therefore accommodate much larger data sets.

    Refines the contract of IPersistentByteArrayStore as follows:
    • A IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest's key is never used when reading.
    • A IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest's key is never used when writing.
    • A IByteArrayStore.ReadRequest must have an index value which is greater than or equal to zero and strictly less than the store's size.
    • Operation IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.INSERT is not supported. Such an operation, which involves shifting contents, would be way too slow to implement given the chosen disk layout (see HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStoreIndex for details).
    • When performing operation IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.REMOVE, the IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest can only have an index value which is equal to that of the last element in the store. Removing elements located in the middle of the store is not supported. Such an operation, which involves shifting contents, would be way too slow to implement given the chosen disk layout (see HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStoreIndex for details).
    • Method JournalingPersistentStoreBase.iterate(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest, com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.IJournalingStoreAccessor.IWriteRequestHandler) follows the index ordering to iterate over the store's contents.
    • Method keys(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler) is not supported.

    Refines the contract of IJournalingStoreAccessor as follows:

    • Method JournalingPersistentStoreBase.iterate(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest, com.camerontec.util.collection.persisted.journaling.IJournalingStoreAccessor.IWriteRequestHandler) follows the index ordering to iterate over the store's contents.
    In order to provide optimal writing performance, write requests are appended to journal files, which act as the main data store, and data contained in journal files gets indexed asynchronously into an HighCapacityIndexedJournalingPersistentStoreIndex. Since this index is stored on disk, the size of the actual data set has no impact on the memory footprint.

    Read and write operations are achieved with zero object creation.

    See JournalingPersistentStoreBase for further details on the implementation or journaling persistent stores.

    The minimum memory footprint of this implementation is 608 Kb per instance. Below is a break-down:
    • Journal reading buffer: 64 Kb
    • Journal writing buffer: 128 Kb when write buffering is off (gets flushed at each write), as per property write-buffer-size (32 Kb - 1 Mb) otherwise.
    • Indexer backlog: as per property indexer-memory-limit (starting from 0.5 Mb)
    • Version history: 0 if version history recording is off, 8 bytes times the value of property version-history-size otherwise
    This implementation is not thread-safe.

        MissingJournalFileException - if a journal file appears to be missing when trying to load the journal from disk

      • updateWriteRequestIndexInAppendContext

        protected void updateWriteRequestIndexInAppendContext(IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest writeRequest)
        Description copied from class: JournalingPersistentStoreBase
        Implementation hook for concrete stores which support append semantics.

        There is no explicit IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.type specifying that a value should be appended to a store. Rather, sequential stores which support append context do so via a combination of IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.SET and a negative index. This is effectively a short cut for the caller as it does not need to query the current store size first, which is better done at the level of the store itself since then single threaded context may be assumed.

        Sequential stores which support append context are therefore required to provide an implementation of this method which rewrites the IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.index field of the specified writeRequest with the current store size. The convenience method JournalingPersistentStoreBase.updateWriteRequestIndexWithCurrentSizeInAppendContext(com.camerontec.util.collection.IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest) is provided for this purpose.

        Overrides:
        updateWriteRequestIndexInAppendContext in class JournalingPersistentStoreBase
        Parameters:
        writeRequest - The write request to be rewritten.

      • validateWrite

        protected void validateWrite(IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest request)
                      throws IllegalArgumentException,
                             UnsupportedPersistenceOperationException
        Validates a write to the store.
        Specified by:
        validateWrite in class JournalingPersistentStoreBase
        Parameters:
        request - the write request
        Throws:
        IllegalArgumentException -
        • if the write request's type is IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.SET and the write request's index is not positive and less than the store's size
        • if the write request's type is IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.REMOVE and the store is empty
        UnsupportedPersistenceOperationException -
        • if the write request's type is IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.INSERT
        • if the write request's type is IByteArrayStore.WriteRequest.Type.REMOVE and the write request's index is not that of the last element in the store

      • keys

        public void keys(IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler handler)
        Description copied from interface: IByteArrayStore
        Iterates through the keys in the store.
        Parameters:
        handler - iteration handler. Method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) in this handler is called in turn for each key in the store. The iteration can be stopped at any time by having method IByteArrayStore.IKeyHandler.key(BytesSegment) return false.
